function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Variability in uv irradiation experiment methodologies and results.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in inactivating sars-cov-1 and mers-cov compared to influenza a","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Substrate or medium influencing the magnitude of the z value achieved for inactivating microbes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low penetration depth of uv light through concentrated suspensions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Paucity of good quality data on uv-c irradiation of sars-cov-1, sars-cov-2, and mers-cov in the air","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the validity of using z value for mhv coronavirus as a surrogate for sars-cov-2 in air","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Modeling expected and worst-case scenarios for upper-room uvgi installations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on surrogate z ur values for sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the effects of fragmented uv doses on virus inactivation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on room air mixing for effective uvgi air disinfection","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor room air mixing and stagnant regions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate uv irradiation of larger aerosol particles","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 due to poor ventilation and air movement","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to uvgi if not properly installed or maintained.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor ventilation efficacy leading to high concentration of viral particles in the room space.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the value of the upper-room uv susceptibility constant for sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of well-mixed room air may not reflect real-world conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of the model used in assessing upper-room uvgi effectiveness","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on upper-room uvgi as the sole intervention for inhibiting covid-19 transmission in buildings.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of sars-cov-2 through contact with contaminated surfaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effectiveness of the anti-sars-cov-2 coatings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown chemical groups to inactivate sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Exposure to cuprous oxide as a pesticide and marine antifoulant","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of systemic toxicity associated with copper exposure","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inactivation of sars-cov-2 using cu 2 o particles bound into a film","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to virus due to handling of materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection leading to virus survival on surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contaminated equipment and tools as sources of transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of ethanol in the fabrication process","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to argon plasma during cleaning process","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Testing for sars-cov-2 inactivation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to chemicals such as nitric acid and pure gopts","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination risk from unattached polymer chains during film fabrication","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of exposure to cu2o particles during film fabrication and testing","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of biological testing with sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disinfection process and handling of sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Handling of infectious materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Swift and dramatic inactivation of sars-cov-2 by the cu 2 o/pu coating, reducing the viral titer by 99.9% in 1 hour.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variations in sample preparation and testing leading to differences in the effectiveness of the coating.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to resolve the effects of the polyurethane-only coating, demonstrating the necessity of cu 2 o in the film.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for incomplete inactivation of the virus due to variability in wettability of the cu 2 o/pu film","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discrepancies in reported biocidal mechanisms of cu 2 o compounds for viral inactivation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain virucidal activity against specific viruses, such as sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to sars-cov-2 virus during testing of the cu 2 o/pu film","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inactivation of sars-cov-2 virus on the coated surface","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Storage of coated samples under water for 13 days","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cu 2 o/pu film can be removed by heavy deliberate scratching","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cationic polymer coatings did not speed inactivation of sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential release of sars-cov-2 virus from uncoated samples in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential failure of other coating technologies amine and ammonium-based polymers to inactivate the virus","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
